members.name: argsFromArray
members.comment:
Fills out arguments from array

Useful for simple text-only query params
Postgres infers a data type for the parameter in the same way it would do for an untyped literal string.

members.name: argsVariadic
members.comment: Fills out arguments from variadic arguments

members.name: preparedStatementName
members.comment:
Access to prepared statement name

Use it to prepare queries

name: dpq2.connection

members.name: ConnectionStart
members.comment: dumb flag for Connection ctor parametrization

members.name: this
members.comment: Makes a new connection to the database server

members.name: this
members.comment: Starts creation of a connection to the database server in a nonblocking manner

members.name: isNonBlocking
members.comment: Returns the blocking status of the database connection

members.name: resetStart
members.comment:
Begin reset the communication channel to the server, in a nonblocking manner

Useful only for non-blocking operations.

members.name: status
members.comment: Returns the status of the connection

members.name: transactionStatus
members.comment:
Returns the current in-transaction status of the server.
        The status can be:
 PQTRANS_IDLE    - currently idle
 PQTRANS_ACTIVE  - a command is in progress (reported only when a query has been sent to the server and not yet completed)
 PQTRANS_INTRANS - idle, in a valid transaction block
 PQTRANS_INERROR - idle, in a failed transaction block
 PQTRANS_UNKNOWN - reported if the connection is bad

members.name: consumeInput
members.comment:
If input is available from the server, consume it

Useful only for non-blocking operations.

members.name: posixSocket
members.comment: Obtains the file descriptor number of the connection socket to the server

members.name: posixSocketDuplicate
members.comment: Obtains duplicate file descriptor number of the connection socket to the server

members.name: socket
members.comment:
Obtains std.socket.Socket of the connection to the server

Due to a limitation of Socket actually for the Socket creation
duplicate of internal posix socket will be used.

members.name: errorMessage
members.comment: Returns the error message most recently generated by an operation on the connection

members.name: setNoticeProcessor
members.comment:
Sets or examines the current notice processor

 Returns the previous notice receiver or processor function pointer, and sets the new value.
 If you supply a null function pointer, no action is taken, but the current pointer is returned.

members.name: getResult
members.comment:
Get next result after sending a non-blocking commands. Can return null.

Useful only for non-blocking operations.

members.name: setSingleRowMode
members.comment: Select single-row mode for the currently-executing query

members.name: cancel
members.comment:
Try to cancel query

     If the cancellation is effective, the current command will
     terminate early and return an error result or exception. If the
     cancellation will fails (say, because the server was already done
     processing the command) there will be no visible result at all.

members.name: connStringCheck
members.comment:
Check connection options in the provided connection string

Throws exception if connection string isn't passes check.

members.name: doCancel
members.comment:
Requests that the server abandon processing of the current command

     Throws exception if cancel request was not successfully dispatched.

     Successful dispatch is no guarantee that the request will have any
     effect, however. If the cancellation is effective, the current
     command will terminate early and return an error result
     (exception). If the cancellation fails (say, because the server
     was already done processing the command), then there will be no
     visible result at all.

comment:
Represents connection to the PostgreSQL server

 Most functions is correspond to those in the documentation of Postgres:
 $(HTTPS https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq.html)

name: dpq2.conv.arrays

members.name: toValue
members.comment: Converts dynamic or static array of supported types to the coresponding PG array type value

comment: Module to handle PostgreSQL array types

members.name: bsonToValue
members.comment: Default type will be used for NULL value and for array without detected type

members.name: toValue
members.comment:
Converts types implicitly convertible to string to PG Value.
    Note that if string is null it is written as an empty string.
    If NULL is a desired DB value, Nullable!string can be used instead.

members.name: toValue
members.comment: Constructs Value from array of bytes

members.name: toValue
members.comment: Constructs Value from TimeStamp or from TimeStampUTC

members.name: toValue
members.comment:
Constructs Value from DateTime
    It uses Timestamp without TZ as a resulting PG type

members.name: toValue
members.comment:
Constructs Value from SysTime
    Note that SysTime has a precision in hnsecs and PG TimeStamp in usecs.
    It means that PG value will have 10 times lower precision.
    And as both types are using long for internal storage it also means that PG TimeStamp can store greater range of values than SysTime.

members.name: isValidPointType
members.comment: Checks that type have "x" and "y" members of returning type "double"

members.name: isValidBoxType
members.comment: Checks that type have "min" and "max" members of suitable returning type of point

name: dpq2.conv.time

members.name: binaryValueAs
members.comment:
Returns value timestamp with time zone as SysTime

    Note that SysTime has a precision in hnsecs and PG TimeStamp in usecs.
    It means that PG value will have 10 times lower precision.
    And as both types are using long for internal storage it also means that PG TimeStamp can store greater range of values than SysTime.

    Because of these differences, it can happen that database value will not fit to the SysTime range of values.

members.name: binaryValueAs
members.comment: Returns value data as native Date

members.name: binaryValueAs
members.comment: Returns value time without time zone as native TimeOfDay

members.name: binaryValueAs
members.comment: Returns value timestamp without time zone as TimeStamp

members.name: binaryValueAs
members.comment: Returns value timestamp with time zone as TimeStampUTC

members.name: binaryValueAs
members.comment: Returns value timestamp without time zone as DateTime (it drops the fracSecs from the database value)

members.name: date
members.comment:
Date and time of TimeStamp

 If value is '-infinity' or '+infinity' it will be equal PgDate.min or PgDate.max

members.name: this
members.type: pure (PgDate d, TimeOfDay t = TimeOfDay(), Duration fractionalSeconds = Duration.zero)

members.name: min
members.comment: Returns the TimeStamp farthest in the past which is representable by TimeStamp.

members.name: max
members.comment: Returns the TimeStamp farthest in the future which is representable by TimeStamp.

members.name: earlier
members.comment: '-infinity', earlier than all other time stamps

members.name: later
members.comment: 'infinity', later than all other time stamps

members.name: TTimeStamp
members.comment: Structure to represent PostgreSQL Timestamp with/without time zone

members.name: TimeStampUTC

comment:
PostgreSQL time types binary format.

   Copyright: Â© 2014 DSoftOut
   Authors: NCrashed <ncrashed@gmail.com>

members.name: PGtimestamp
members.comment: Both date and time without time zone

members.name: PGtimestamptz
members.comment: Both date and time stored in UTC time zone

members.name: as
members.comment:
Returns cell value as a native string based type from text or binary formatted field.
    Throws: AssertError if the db value is NULL and Nullable is not used to retrieve the value

members.name: as
members.comment:
Returns value as D type value from binary formatted field.
    Throws: AssertError if the db value is NULL and Nullable is not used to retrieve the value

members.name: Dpq2Exception
members.comment: Base for all dpq2 exceptions classes

name: dpq2.oids

members.name: oidConvTo
members.comment:
Convert between array Oid and element Oid or vice versa

 Params:
  s = "array" or "element"
  type = source object type

members.name: isNativeInteger
members.comment: Checks if Oid type can be mapped to native D integer

members.name: isNativeFloat
members.comment: Checks if Oid type can be mapped to native D float

members.name: OidType
members.comment: Enum of Oid types defined in PG

comment:
PostgreSQL major types oids.

   Copyright: Â© 2014 DSoftOut
   Authors: NCrashed <ncrashed@gmail.com>

name: dpq2
comment:
Main module

 Include it to use common functions.

members.name: sendQuery
members.comment: Submits a command to the server without waiting for the result(s)

members.name: sendQueryParams
members.comment: Submits a command and separate parameters to the server without waiting for the result(s)

members.name: sendQueryPrepared
members.comment: Sends a request to execute a prepared statement with given parameters, without waiting for the result(s)

members.name: getNextNotify
members.comment: Returns null if no notifies was received

members.name: prepare
members.comment:
Submits a request to create a prepared statement with the given parameters, and waits for completion.
Returns: Result of query preparing
members.type: immutable(Result)(string statementName, string sqlStatement, in Oid[] oids = null)

members.name: prepareEx
members.comment:
Submits a request to create a prepared statement with the given parameters, and waits for completion.

Throws an exception if preparing failed.
members.type: void(string statementName, string sqlStatement, in Oid[] oids = null)

members.name: execPrepared
members.comment: Submits a request to execute a prepared statement with given parameters, and waits for completion.

members.name: sendPrepare
members.comment: Sends a request to create a prepared statement with the given parameters, without waiting for completion.
members.type: void(string statementName, string sqlStatement, in Oid[] oids = null)

members.name: describePrepared
members.comment: Submits a request to obtain information about the specified prepared statement, and waits for completion.

members.name: sendDescribePrepared
members.comment: Submits a request to obtain information about the specified prepared statement, without waiting for completion.

members.name: Queries
members.comment:
Extends Connection by adding query methods

Just use it as Connection.* methods.

members.name: Result
members.comment: Contains result of query regardless of whether it contains an error or data answer

members.name: status
members.comment: Returns the result status of the command.

members.name: resultErrorMessage
members.comment: Returns the error message associated with the command, or an empty string if there was no error.

members.name: resultErrorField
members.comment: Returns an individual field of an error report.

members.name: cmdStatus
members.comment:
Returns the command status tag from the SQL command that generated the PGresult
 Commonly this is just the name of the command, but it might include
 additional data such as the number of rows processed.

members.name: cmdTuples
members.comment:
Returns the number of rows affected by the SQL command.
 This function returns a string containing the number of rows affected by the SQL statement
 that generated the Answer. This function can only be used following the execution of
 a SELECT, CREATE TABLE AS, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, MOVE, FETCH, or COPY statement,
 or an EXECUTE of a prepared query that contains an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement.
 If the command that generated the Anser was anything else, cmdTuples returns an empty string.

members.name: isArray
members.comment: Checks if column type is array

members.name: columnNum
members.comment: Returns column number by field name

members.name: columnName
members.comment: Returns column name by field number

members.name: columnExists
members.comment: Returns true if the column exists, false if not

members.name: nParams
members.comment:
Returns the number of parameters of a prepared statement.
     This function is only useful when inspecting the result of describePrepared.
     For other types of queries it will return zero.

members.name: paramType
members.comment:
Returns the data type of the indicated statement parameter.
     Parameter numbers start at 0.
     This function is only useful when inspecting the result of describePrepared.
     For other types of queries it will return zero.

members.name: Answer
members.comment: Contains result of query with valid data answer

members.name: rangify
members.comment: Creates forward range from immutable Answer

members.name: Row
members.comment: Represents one row from the answer table

members.name: this
members.originalType: immutable ref (immutable Answer answer, in size_t row)

members.name: size
members.comment: Returns the actual length of a cell value in bytes.

members.name: isNULL
members.comment:
Checks if value is NULL

Do not confuse it with Nullable's isNull method

members.name: opIndex
members.comment: Returns cell value by column number

members.name: opIndex
members.comment: Returns cell value by field name

members.name: columnNum
members.comment: Returns column number by field name

members.name: columnName
members.comment: Returns column name by field number

members.name: Array
members.comment:
Represents Value as array

Actually it is a reference to the cell value of the answer table

members.name: length
members.comment:
Returns number of elements in array
Useful for one-dimensional arrays

members.name: opIndex
members.comment:
Returns Value struct by index
Useful for one-dimensional arrays

members.name: opIndex
members.comment:
Returns Value struct by index
Useful for one-dimensional arrays

members.name: getValue
members.comment:
Returns Value struct
Useful for multidimensional arrays

members.name: pid
members.comment: Returns process ID of notifying server process

members.name: ResponseException
members.comment: Covers errors of Answer creation when data was not received due to syntax errors, etc

members.name: AnswerException
members.comment: Covers errors of access to Answer data

members.name: Value
members.comment:
Represents table cell or argument value

Internally it is a ubyte[].
If it returned by Answer methods it contains a reference to the data of
the server answer and it can not be accessed after Answer is destroyed.

members.name: this
members.originalType: inout pure ref @safe (immutable(ubyte)[] data, in OidType oidType, bool isNull = false, in ValueFormat format = ValueFormat.BINARY)

members.name: this
members.originalType: pure ref @safe (in ValueFormat format, in OidType oidType)

members.name: isNull
members.comment: Indicates if the value is NULL

members.name: isArray
members.comment: Indicates if the value is array type

members.name: NOT_ARRAY
members.comment: Format of the value isn't array

members.name: NOT_BINARY
members.comment: Format of the column isn't binary

members.name: NOT_TEXT
members.comment: Format of the column isn't text string

members.name: NOT_IMPLEMENTED
members.comment: Support of this type isn't implemented (or format isn't matches to specified D type)

members.name: SIZE_MISMATCH
members.comment: Value size is not matched to the Postgres value

members.name: DATE_VALUE_OVERFLOW
members.comment: Date value isn't fits to Postgres binary Date value
